title: United States History Power Standards: Power Standards
subject: Social Studies (2014-2020)

document.title: Indiana Department of Education College and Career Readiness

DC9109A17C3E4274AD8673E92C5E158F.description:
Explain the significance of social, economic and political issues during the period 1980 to the present and how

these issues affected individuals and organizations.

657F358465CB4C43863DDE3250427B6F.description: The Contemporary United States: 1980 to the Present

BDDF8D6CD86746AA97A92237F43CFB4A.description: Analyze the foreign and domestic consequences of U.S. involvement in Vietnam.

48BFF372E3E6491192981226F6D462A2.description: The United States in Troubled Times: 1960 to 1980

1D4C40E8BCDF4F258C197C73D44DF9B9.description:
Summarize and assess the various actions which characterized the early struggle for civil rights (1945-1960).

(Government; Individuals, Society and Culture)

C17DD011F17D45C795D31DAF730E3618.description:
Understand the domino theory and its relationship to the principle of containment. Identify key events and individuals

as well as their connections to post World War II tensions (Cold War). (Government, Geography)

E4C6E2A2901848A2A346FA01850DFEA9.description: Explain how World War II led to the rise of the United States and the Soviet Union as rival superpowers.

7772D6A9240E4F82AA353F8119B75953.description: Identify and explain key events from Versailles to Pearl Harbor that resulted in the United States entry into World War II. (Government, Geography)

7B607F0305DF41DFBE34C4426C9357D0.description: The United States and World War II: 1939 to 1945

353EBF8DE860412BB805E5A32966ADF7.description: Identify and describe the contributions of political and social reformers during the Great Depression Era. (Government; Economics; Individuals, Society and Culture)

AFA4F8FBEE0E42CBAA036D401D924322.description: Identify new cultural movements of the 1920s and analyze how these movements reflected and changed American society. (Individuals, Society, and Culture)

49C969B44A0344C1AB7ADE5D2D89366B.description: Modern United States Prosperity and Depression: Post WW I - 1939

7DE3D309B99F4ACF9E02B5B3BCF93BB6.description: Describe the events and people central to the transformation of the United States developing into a world power. (Government, Geography)

0E637D7B1E3E4E29B66C1860EEC882A9.description: Emergence of the Modern United States: 1897 to 1920

70C9EA6CA8CD43F28B70ED95271BD98A.description: Describe the economic developments that transformed the United States into a major industrial power and the factors necessary for industrialization. (Economics)

8319BEC87B4F4D5B924154FA1035623D.description: Development of the Industrial United States: 1870 to 1900
